intro: Danais, commonly known as the "crown imperator," is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can grow up to 12 inches in diameter. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a waxy texture. Danais is often cultivated for its ornamental value in warm climates.
